abstract.p: Added Value in London, strategic marketing consulting company, is entering US by acquiring Fusion 5, advertising agency that offers strategic and research services; Siegelgale, Internet branding and strategic advertising agency, acquires Spalab, which specializes in Web, broadband and wireless digital media technologies and design (S)

block.p: Added Value in London, a strategic marketing consulting company, is entering the United States by acquiring Fusion 5 in Westport, Conn., an agency that offers strategic and research services.
Added Value in London, a strategic marketing consulting company, is entering the United States by acquiring Fusion 5 in Westport, Conn., an agency that offers strategic and research services.
Terms of the deal call for Added Value to pay $9 million in cash and stock initially, with a potential second payment of up to $20 million in cash and stock over three years.

Fusion 5, which will be renamed Fusion 5/Added Value USA, has 30 employees and revenue estimated at more than $10 million from clients like Coca-Cola, Disney and Ford. Fusion 5/Added Value USA will operate as an autonomous unit of Added Value, which is owned by the Tempus Group; Patrick Meyer, 47, continues as president, and Robin Austin, 46, continues as principal and chief creative officer.
And Siegelgale in New York, an Internet branding and strategy agency, acquired Spalab in New York, which specializes in Web, broadband and wireless digital media technologies and design.
Terms of the stock transaction were not disclosed.

Spalab, with 10 employees working for clients like Comedy Central and Ben & Jerry's Homemade, will operate as a unit of Siegelgale. The two principals at Spalab, Ari Jacobs and Jurgen Altziebler, both 29, become creative directors at Siegelgale.
